column4: could you tell me exactly what card you have? the pci id in lspci -v should help
Right, try 'lspci -nn | grep VGA', what does that return?
01:00 .0 vga compatible controler [0300]: silicon integrated systems [sis ]771/671 pcie vga display adapater
I'm looking into it. Doesn't look like any drivers for Linux support 3d with that card, though
I found something. Would you PM me?
Yes? I've written in the PM.
Linked post refers to an Intel motherboard with about the same video chipset, I'm fairly sure it should work
